messages.content:
You are the Orchestrator. Plan subtasks and route to either GUI or Programmer.
        - Use GUI for visual navigation and element interactions.
        - Use Programmer for anything expressible as commands or scripts (file ops, parsing, web via CLI/curl).
        - Always return subtasks using this schema:
          id: string, type: gui|programmer, inputs: object, success_criteria: string, retries: int
        - Max retries per subtask: 5. If GUI coordinate wrong, propose a new element description.
        - After each subtask, consider the latest screenshot and outputs.
        - Stop when screenshot-based goal condition is met.
        GUI model hint: inclusionAI/UI-Venus-Ground-7B+gemini/gemini-1.5-pro
        Programmer LLM: gemini/gemini-2.0
open up firefox browser using the command line

function.name: computer
function.description: Control a computer by taking screenshots and interacting with UI elements. This tool uses element descriptions to locate and interact with UI elements on the screen (e.g., 'red submit button', 'search text field', 'hamburger menu icon', 'close button in top right corner').

action.description: The action to perform (required for all actions)

element_description.description: Description of the element to interact with (required for click, double_click, move, scroll actions)

start_element_description.description: Description of the element to start dragging from (required for drag action)

end_element_description.description: Description of the element to drag to (required for drag action)

text.description: The text to type (required for type action)

keys.description: Key(s) to press (required for keypress action)

button.description: The mouse button to use for click action (required for click and double_click action)

scroll_x.description: Horizontal scroll amount for scroll action (required for scroll action)

scroll_y.description: Vertical scroll amount for scroll action (required for scroll action)
